channel.title: Viewing current circuit
channel.description:
Is it possible to view the current circuit being used by each process inside the Workstation? Like "Process 1, Current Circuit: entry node IP, intermediate node IP, exit node IP".
Thanks.

item.title: Viewing current circuit
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
You either forgot to scroll down or the circuit expired.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewing current circuit
item.dc:creator: tammor
item.description:
Just know that we can see active circuits in Arm.

However my IP from https://check.torproject.org/ and the IP given by perl script are not listed under Arm->Connections. Is that normal?

Read full topic

item.title: Viewing current circuit
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Any Tor controller should not be a security issue on the gateway.
( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller )

Use Arm.
( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Arm )

However, on the gateway I don’t think any Tor controller exists, that can distinguish which circuit came from which workstation, workstation process, let a lone from which browser tab.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewing current circuit
item.dc:creator: tammor
item.description:
If viewing such information in Workstation is a security issue, what about being able to view it in Gateway?
And what I mentioned was not limited only to Tor Browser but every connection or process that connects to the outside world.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewing current circuit
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Unsupported. Just now added to documentation:

Whonix

Tor Browser
